intro: Weinmannia stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-staminate weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its distinctive foliage and inflorescence. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a rough, hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical heads, which are a defining feature of the genus Weinmannia.
